channel.title: Easy question. *please answer*
channel.description: Will I be able to log on my server with the no-ip or do I have to log in from localhost - 0.0.0.0 but other people use the no-ip? Thanks.

item.title: Easy question. *please answer*
item.dc:creator: @drew876567 drew876567
item.description:
@drew876567 wrote:

Ok, you ALWAYS on your computer have to use 127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0 or whatever. You will NEVER be able to login through the no-ip address.

Hoster = You (GnarlyUnicorn)

Other people on your network = <---- explains itself

Other people, outside of your network = People on the internet outside your house

Hoster: localhost, 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, etc.

Other people on your network: IPv4 address.

Other people, outside of your network: No-IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy question. *please answer*
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

Thanks man one more thing though.

When I want to run the client I have to change it to 0.0.0.0? I can’t actually log onto my server using the no-ip from my computer?

Basically if I send them the client I’ll change the client ip to my no-ip but when I use it I’ll change client to 0.0.0.0 thats really what I want to know. Because when I change my client ip to the no-ip it doesn’t let me log on.

Read full topic
